synopsis: Takuya, Koji, Zoe, Tommy and J.P. descend to the Digiworld where they are confronted by Cerberusmon. Takuya's Digivice is activated and the Digispirit of his Digimon is called, transforming him into Agunimon for battle.

After the battle, Takuya doesn't remember what happened but he obtained a Digicode. J.P. and Tommy get separated from the group and are soon captured by Pagumon Digimons. Meanwhile Koji acquires the Digispirit and he tries to save J.P. and Tommy.
Neemon told the gang they could take the train back to reality but they all decided to stick it out in the Digital World.

The gang tries to hitch a ride to the Forest Terminal but while deciding which way to go the group splits up. Zoe, J.P., Neemon, and Bokomon end up in Breezy Village. Zoe needs to Spirit Evolve when the Fungus Brothers Digivolve but it doesn't go well.
The gang winds up at Wind Factory where they meet the Kokuwamon, a group of machine Digimon who are being forced into slave labor. So Takuya comes up with a plan to save the little guys.

title.jp: A Molehilll Out of a Mountain

synopsis: While trying to find food, the gang met up with the Shellnumemon and they agreed to help rescue the women from the evil Grumblemon. When they told the snails they were Legendary Warriors, they were captured and traded for the women!
After losing the fight with Grumblemon, Takuya, Koji & Tommy fell into a world of living toys, where they all fought with each other!

On their way to the Forest Kingdom, J.P., Zoe, Bokomon & Neemon came upon a school for young Digimon. A big storm came through and almost washed away the school but Zoe & J.P. Spirit Evolved just in time.

Starving and tired, the gang decided to make camp but soon discovered the forest was full of these freaky trees. While sleeping, Tapirmon came under the influence of Kepyrmon, who planted bad dreams into a sleeping Tommy.

After getting this weird e-mail, Koji broke away from the group with Neemon & Bokomon tagging along. The 3 of them ran into Gotsumon, a rock Digimon, who was looking to awaken the Spirit. Then, their old pal Grumblemon came back for some more fun.
Bokomon took the gang to get their futures told by Shamanmon, the fortune teller and just as Shamanmon started, Grumblemon attacked.

title.jp: Fear and Loathing in Los Arboles

synopsis: When Takuya Beast Spirit Evolved to Burning Greymon, he couldn't control himself. It finally took a lot of reasoning from little Tommy to get Takuya to tame the Beast within.

title.jp: Better an Egg Than an Egg Shell

synopsis: The guys made it to Forest Terminal but no one was there. Down the road at a castle they met Socerimon & Seraphimon just as Grumblemon and the other goons attack! Mercurymon beat Seraphimon and all that was left was a Digi-Egg.
After the wild ride on a Trailmon, our heroes find themselves trapped in an underground cavern. Unfortunately, Arbormon & Grumblemon figured out where they were and attacked.

The gang decided to take a little vacation only to find out that the food and free beach gear was part of a plot to separate them from their D-Tectors. Then when Ranamon shows up, Zoe was the only one able to Spirit Evolve.
The Digidestined hunted for their D-Tectors but those Toucanmon flew off with them. So they all set sail on a raft they built but of course, Ranamon attacked. Evolved into Zephyrmon.
The gang finally made it to the Autumn Leaf Fair but they still couldn't find the Toucanmon.
On their way to the Rose Morning Star, the gang made a stop at the Great Trailmon Race. Everyone decided to join the festivities and partnered up with a Trailmon.
The gang headed to Hamburgermon Village but Petaldramon and his cronies had ravaged the hamlet, taking the town's top burgermeister hostage in the process.

While on the way to the Rose Morning Star, our heroes got dumped at the Dark Gate. Cherubimon called a meeting of the Legendary Lunkheads and Arbormon decided it was time to get rid of the gang once and for all.
Not only did Duskmon throw BurningGreymon around, he took the Digidestined to task without even flinching.

Takuya took Dark Trailmon back to the real world. However, on the way home he turned into this freaky half-human, half-Digimon. To make matters worse, Takuya returned to the same day he left for the Digital World.

Having survived his trip to the Real World, Takuya returned to the Digital World on a mission. He realized that being a Digimon may be fun but it's also serious. As was the trouble that J.P., Zoe and Tommy were in.
The gang headed off to the Rose Morning Star but the trip was cut short because the kids were sucked into Sephirothmon. While trying to find an exit, J.P. was pushed into another dimension.

Sephirothmon decided the guys needed a little one-on-one attention, so he split them up to face their personal demons. Tommy had some unresolved stuff with his brother to work out and Koji was plagued by his deepest fears about friendship.
Zoe is stuck in the Water Sphere, where she has a flashback about being teased. She soon finds a group of Honeybeemon who are attempting to capture her for Ranamon.
Koji & Takuya are still stuck inside the Sephirothmon. Zoe, J.P. and Tommy Spirit Evolved to help them but they couldn't get back inside.
It's bad enough when Mercurymon corners you in a world of mirrors but then he uses Seraphimon's data to turn into ShadowSeraphimon.

When we last left Koji, he had Fusion Evolved into Beowolfmon and was trying to catch up with Duskmon. Meanwhile, as everyone was celebrating the birth of Patamon, Sephirothmon decided to crash the party.

As the battle between Duskmon & Beowolfmon raged on, Patamon was doing his best to lead the gang to Koji but Cherubimon had them trapped. Then Cherubimon took advantage of Koichi's amnesia and gave Duskmon his Beast Spirit.
After the gang finally get back together, Koji runs off after Velgemon to find out their connection.

Duskmon finally realized that he had a human brother, Koji, so Cherubimon corrupted him with more dark memories of his past. Zoe, Tommy and J.P. tried to contact the others about the Rose Morning Star and Bokomon and Neemon went to find Patamon.
Waking up from a dreadful nightmare was terrible for Koji and Koichi but more than that, Koichi realized that Cherubimon used him for his own purposes.
With a new goal in mind, the Digidestined kids arrive at the Rose Morning Star. After defeating two Phantomons to gain entry, they are greeted by Goatmon, a wise Digimon.
The Digidestined meet up with Ophanimon, who is currently facing off against Cherubimon. After trying their attacks in vein, they soon learn that their powers are weakened.
Takuya and Koji spirit evolved together and fly the others to safety. The two are powerful and actually winning the battle against Cherubimon.
Now that Cherubimon has absorbed all the information of the Digital World, he transforms into a very tough opponent but EmperorGreymon and MagnaGarurumon try their best.
With Cherubimon defeated, the Digidestined are happier than ever. As they try to sort things out, they arrive at a large tunnel entrance where they meet a helpful Baromon.

title.jp: The Man in the Moon Is You

synopsis: After being blasted away by Dynasmon's attack, the kids awake to find themselves on the blue moon. They hitch a ride with a Starmon to a space station.
The Royal Knights destroyed another location and then made their way to steel town where Takuya and the gang are. Steel town is mostly buildings made of metal and the sun reflects off them.

Dynasmon locks Tommy and the children in a cell until they reveal where the "key" is. As the kids try and escape by throwing a bomb at the cell bars, Dynasmon grabs the Elder and forces them to tell the Royal Knights where the "key" is.

The gang ends up at the Village of Beginnings where Digimon are born. They are introduced to Swanmon who takes care of all the babies. There are lots of them because the Trailmon are too scared to take them to their families.

After the Village of Beginnings is destroyed, a group of Poyomon warns Takuya that the Flame Town Terminal is going to be attacked. A SkullSatamon grabs a Palmon, questioning where the Digi-Code near Flame Terminal is.

title.jp: Now You See It, Now You Don't

synopsis: The Royal Knights destroy another area and send the Digi-Code to Lucemon. Gotsumon defends the sacred jewels at the Gotsumon Village. Koji decides that Gotsumon should come with them since he wants to help fight the Royal Knights.

title.jp: All Aboard the Tag Team Express

synopsis: With only two sections of the Digital World remaining, the Royal Knights are on the hunt for the next fractal code. Since no one knows where the fractal code is, the Digidestined have set up a post.

title.jp: To Make the World Go Away

synopsis: KaiserGreymon and MagnaGarurumon, along with the rest, arrive at Ophanimon's Castle. When they enter the Castle, they encounter the Castle librarian and caretaker Nefertimon on the balcony.

The kids are on one of the 3 Digital Moons and Koichi is still shocked about what Crusadermon said to him. The Royal Knights still question Lucemon if they still had an agreement to take them to earth.
With Lucemon about to destroy Takuya, Zoe, J.P. Tommy and Koji once and for all, Lowemon steps in to stop the attack.

Koji is clutching his stomach from the new spirits and Takuya is raging after Lucemon. Susanomon emerges and the final battle between good and evil soon begins. Lucemon uses his powers of Light and Dark to envelop Susanomon.
All the kids are down in the train station after getting pummeled by Lucemon. Takuya gets ready to fight again, however, the others stop him because Lucemon was able to regenerate.
